choices: I'll take my chances with the fruit vendor.
1.content:
OK, OK, you're at the beginning. Congratulations, you made it this far.

So what'll it be, the pirates or the angry fruit vendor? Hurry up now, I haven't got all day!
1.title: Start at the beginning, a very good place to start

11.content:
You awake, disoriented, on a bench at a bus stop in totally unfamiliar surroundings.

Where am I, and how the hell did I get here?” you ask yourself, but you have little time to ponder the questions.

An old woman wearing a peasant dress and a babushka starts shaking you and shouting something in a somehwat familiar foreign language. As you attempt to pull away from her she grabs your shoulders forcefully.

"Na co sie przyda?" She pleads. "Czym moge sluzyc?" she shouts, as she shakes you roughly, demanding an answer. But you remember very little of the Slavic tongues you spoke with your grandmother as a child.

"Prosim!" "Dakujem!" you implore as you try to escape her grasp, but "please" and "thank
you" is not what she wants to hear, and probably not even the correct dialect.

Somehow, tripping and stumbling, you manage to elude the old woman. But before you get very far, two rough looking men wearing watchcaps and greasy windbreakers throw
an old fishing net over you.
11.title: It's All Greek to Me

choices: Take your place at the bench and grab a haddock.
111.content:
"...Haul the sheet in as we ride on the wind that our Forefathers harnessed before us.
Hear the bells ring as the tide rigging sings, it's a son of a gun of a chorus...."

You slowly regain consciousness, aware of an old Jimmy Buffet tune playing on a boombox on the deck. Your hands are tied behind your back lashed to a mast. A tall bare-chested man with leathery skin and a shaved head is singing along with the boombox in an off-key gravelly voice while swabbing the deck with a grey spaghetti mop.

"Arrr! Shut that blasted CD player off Jason, and quit yer yowling! This ain't no Carnival Cruise sing along!" the captain exclaims. "And untie our new deck hand. There's work to be done, an we're far enough out now to where he won't be thinkin' a jumpin' ship to swim for shore."

Jason shuts off the boombox and pulls a knife out from his belt and cuts the ropes from your hands. He leads you towards the rear deck, where you see three men standing over a bench cleaning fish. He hands you a fish scaling knife. "Get to work matey! Ya gotta earn yer keep if ya wanta be fed on this ship!"
111.title: Son of a Sailor

choices: Smash the lamp, start a fire, incite the crew to mutiny.
Use the lamp to make hand shadow puppets on the sails.
1111.content:
You pick up the knife and step up to the bench, resigned to your fate. "I see we've
got a new fish on board, mates!" A big blond haired guy at the bench voices. "How'd they get you?" But you're not interested in conversation, so you grab a fish and start cutting.

"No need to be koi with us buddy, we've all been shanghaied into servitude here!" the man says, but before you can reply, a short shifty looking guy towards the back of the bench speaks up: "Walleye wasn't, I signed on on porpoise with the Cap'n, just for the halibut, and a finer grouper sailors I've never seen!"

"Ah shut yer mouth mackerel knock your block off!" the big man replies.

"Listen here, you dumb pollock, I've had enough of your crappie attitude, cod dammit!" the short man responds.

The Captain suddenly appears: "Gar! I'm tired of herring you carp! One more word
outa either of you an I'll slit you both from gullet to gills! You'll be floundering on the deck and even the ship's sturgeon won't be able to save you!"

With this everyone settles down and quietly returns to work. "Would you light the lamprey? It's starting to get dark." a guy towards the middle of the bench calls out
to the short man in the back.

"I'll get it!" you respond, thinking this is your chance to create a diversion.
1111.title: Fish Story

choices: The men make you the new Captain
The men force to walk the plank
11111.content:
The lamp, you discover, is an honest-to-goodness oil lamp. A gentle shake confirms the tank is full.

For a brief moment you consider your options. The sparker is hung nearby, but no one would be surprised to find a new hand is a clumsy hand. Breaking the lamp might gain you the moment you need to change your fate and regain control of your destiny.

Setting your mind firmly to the chosen path, you slam the lamp against the main mast, sending oil streaming down the ancient wood and across the deck. Before anyone can react, you grab the sparker and light the oil.

Within seconds a fire blazes around the base of the main mast and across a portion of the deck. The captain screams out a string of profanity, but you don't stop to listen. Grabbing a nearby spar, you leap to him and slam the hard wood on one side of his brow. With a satisfying crunch, he falls to the deck.

Walleye jumps up to defend his Captain, jabbing forward with his fillet knife extended. Slamming the spar down on his wrist brings another loud crack of breaking bone and sends the knife skittering across the deck.

Next thing you know the whole deck is alive with activity. A small number of crewmen have risen to aid Walleye and the Captain, but the vast majority have risen in mutiny. Some shots ring out amidst the screams and cries of pitched hand to hand combat.

Before long there is nothing left but the groans of the wounded and the crackling of the fire. Most of the Captain's supporters are dead, a few lay among the wounded, and at least two of them have leapt overboard.

Raising your spar in triumph, you lead the men in a cheer and then quickly organize them into two groups, one to care for the wounded and one to put out the fire.
11111.title: Mutiny!

11112.content:
You quickly light the lamp and put your hands in front of it to project shadow
puppets on the sails. You do the usual bird and dog ones, then get fancy and do a pair of boxing Kangaroos.

"Hey, you're pretty good!" The Captain exclaims. "OK mateys, you can stop work
for the night and watch the show." He calls out to the crew.

"Can we have a sing-along?" Ray asks from the back of the table.

"I reckon it would be all right." The Captain replies. "Jason, put on a CD for us." "What'll it be lads?"

The men all shout out their individual favorites: "Jimmy Buffet!" "Grateful Dead!"
"No, Steely Dan!" finally Ray asks "How about Kenny Loggins?"
11112.title: Shadow-boxing the Apocalypse

111122.content:
A hush falls over the group, waiting for the Captain's permission. "All right lads, since it is a special day, I think it would be proper to break out the Kenny Loggins to welcome our new mate aboard." He says, nodding his head towards you.

Jason puts the CD on, and at first only a couple of the guys start softly singing the opening verse:

"Christopher Robin and I walked along
Under branches lit up by the moon,
Posing our questions to Owl and Eeyore
As our days disappeared all too soon...
But I've wandered much further today than I should and I can't seem to find my way back
to the Wood..."

But everyone, including the Captain, joins in on the Chorus:

"So help me if you can I've got to get back To the House at Pooh Corner by one,
You'd be surprised There's so much to be done, Count all the bees in the hive...
Chase all the clouds from the sky..."

You find yourself singing along, as you wipe a tear from your eye. After spending all of
your life searching, you have finally found the place you belong. Good friends, the fresh
sea air, the sun on your back, what more could a man ask for? It won't be an easy life, sailing the Seven Seas while cleaning fish, but you're willing to give it a try...

The words of an old Steely Dan song cross your mind:
"Well, the danger on the rocks has surely passed...
Still I remain tied to the mast..."

"Could it be that I have found my home at last?"

You're starting to believe you have.
111122.title: Sailin' Shoes

choices: Roll the melon like a bowling ball at your pursuers.
12.content:
You wake up lying in the street in a heap of broken wooden crates and smashed fresh fruit, the remains of a vendor’s push-cart. You vaguely remember jumping through a window, but you can’t remember why. For that matter, you’re not even sure who you are or what city you’re in.

A heavy-set man in a stained white apron is standing above you, shouting angrily
in a foreign language. You stagger to your feet, dusting yourself off. Stalling for time while you regain your balance you politely inquire: "Parlez vous
Francais?"

"Oui!" he responds gruffly.

"Well, I sure as hell don't!" you reply, quickly grabbing a small seedless
watermelon and running away.

"Halte! Halte! Ravisseur!" The fruit vendor calls out, and several citizens join in
the chase after you.
12.title: Vive La France !

121.content:
You don't wan't to hit the fruit vendor directly head-on, because if he falls straight down some of the pursuers behind him will be able to get around him and capture you. Your goal is to hit his left leg on an angle, causing him to tumble sideways, effectively causing the rest of your pursuers to trip over him, creating the perfect spill.

You must act quickly, or they will be upon you. You take careful aim and roll the melon...
121.title: Bowling for Bananas

choices: Sing a song for the girl.
1212.content:
You roll the melon carefully but to your dismay it wobbles off the sidewalk and into the gutter. Your pursuers are quickly upon you, and they knock you to the pavement. The
fruit vendor starts beating you on the head with a bunch of unripe bananas, while the rest of your pursuers begin to pelt you with rotten oranges.

"This is horrible, they're beating me to a pulp!" you say to yourself, but you can't help chuckling at the thought as you wipe the mashed bananas and orange pulp from your face.

Suddenly, a little girl of about six or seven steps out from the crowd and begins pulling on the shirt sleeve of the fruit vendor. " Stop mister! Please! You're hurting him!" She pleads.

The fruit vendor looks over at the little girl. She has big sad-looking brown eyes, the kind you see on those kitschy black velvet paintings of kittens or puppy dogs that they sell in the cheap souvenir shops down in Tijuana. Nevertheless, her sad face melts the heart of the fruit vendor, and he mutters a hasty apology to you in broken English and walks away with his head hung low.

The girl looks out accusingly at the rest of your pursuers and they quickly drop the oranges they were throwing and hurry away, ashamed of themselves for their part in the attack.
1212.title: Thank Heaven for Little Girls.

choices: She hits you with her purse.
12121.content:
You are so grateful that the little girl has saved you that you burst into song. It's an old Maurice Chevalier tune you remember hearing him sing in a movie you saw with your
grandmother back when you were a boy:

"Thank heaven for little girls,
for little girls get bigger every day!
Thank heaven for little girls,
they grow up in the most delightful way!
Those little eyes so helpless and appealing,
one day will flash and send you crashin' thru the ceilin'.
Thank heaven for little girls,
thank heaven for them all,
no matter where no matter who,
for without them, what would little boys do?"

As you are finishing the song, a voluptuous young Hispanic woman hastily approaches the girl.

"Aie! Maria! There you are!" She says, grabbing the girl by the arm. She then looks
over at you.
12121.title: Saint of Circumstance

121211.content:
WHAM! The woman suddenly starts beating you with her purse. "Pinche cabron! Feelthy
child molester! Try to seduce my daughter? I show you!" WHAM! she hits you again.

"Please! Stop!" You plead. "I was just singing an innocent song to your girl, to thank her for..." WHAM! she hits you again, harder, and continues cusing you in a mixture of Spanish and English.
121211.title: Cherchez La Femme

choices: Call your broker, buy 1000 shares of China.com.
1212111.content:
You decide to cut your losses and run. She is a good looking woman though, and you find the way she moves her body while acting out her tirade against you very sensual and appealing.

She reminds you of Gina Lollobrigida in an old movie you saw on TV a long time ago, when you were in your early teens. In the movie she was fighting with her lover, and started throwing dishes and yelling at him in broken English. For some reason you found that scene to be particularly arousing at the time.

But you realize that there is little hope for you here, so you make your escape. After running half a block or so you look over your shoulder and see she has given up pursuit and is walking away. You stop to catch your breath and take a last look back, admiring her silhouette in the fading twilight, daydreaming about what might have been.

You notice that you are now standing in front of a small antique shop. The sign
hanging above the store says "Curiosities Unlimited". There are several statues of
bulls made out of china set up on a standing shelf visible through the window. You take this to be an omen.
1212111.title: Amore E Fantasia

choices: It's the woman with the little girl.
12121111.content:
You whip out your cell phone and call your broker: "Get me 1000 shares of China.Com immediately!".

"But sir, I don't think that's a wise choice." your broker replies.

"Never mind, just do it!" you respond.

"Very well, placing a buy order for 1000 shares at market of China.com, ticker CHINA. Current ask is $25.25 a share, is that acceptable?"

"Yes, yes, that's fine. Thank you Matthew." you respond, then hang up and enter the store.

Just as you start to ask the shopkeeper about the bulls, your cell phone rings. You
excuse yourself to answer it.
12121111.title: Bullish on China

choices: Prove Him Right By Jumping Through China Shop Window
121211111.content:
"Are you really sure you want to buy..."

"YES! OUI! Parlez vous anglais!? Sprechen sie? Do you understand the words that are coming outta my mouth!?"

You continue to berate the man when an important question takes hold of your mind.

"Oh uh do you happen to have any idea who I am?"

"Sir what kind of question is that? You've been jumping again haven't you?"
121211111.title: It's your broker.

1212111112.content:
You choose a choice expletive before hurling your phone through the China Shop window and follow suit.

Shatterred glass and expensive statues come crashing down all around you. The customers and clerk stare in wide eyed horror at the horrible gashes all over your face and body.

You stand to regard the crowd when you hear a familiar voice cursing away in a foreign language.

The large vendor from earlier has come back just in time...
1212111112.title: Prove Him Right By Jumping Through China Shop W...

12121111121.content:
You look to the large man and fall terrified to your butt. The pain of having glass go into your butt adds to the tremble in your voice.

"Oh please God no! haven't you done enough to me! No more I beg you! PLEASE!"

The poor vendor who can only speak in French has no idea what you just said and his intimidating snarl causes the crowd to get riled up and go on the attack. A beautiful woman, and a doctor stand among them.
12121111121.title: ...to get blamed!

choices: You Valiantly Stand and Offer the Manager Help
121211111212.content:
You attempt to grab the doctor on his way out but grab his junk instead.

The doctor instinctively punches you in the face.

This draws the attention of half of the mob of China Shop customers while the other half chase the vendor.

They attack the doctor and throw him through an unbusted window, causing further damage to the store. FInally the manager comes out and falls to her knees. You catch a peek under her skirt.
121211111212.title: You Grab the Doctor

choices: Fake being dizzy as an excuse
Give her a funny one line reply
1212111112121.content:
From your vantage point on the floor you've got a perfect view, and you can't resist looking a little longer than you should.

"Have you seen enough, or do you want me to lift my skirt a little higher?" she says angrily.
1212111112121.title: You Continue To Stare

choices: She believes you, feels sorry for you
12121111121211.content: "Ummm, sorry, I'm kinda stunned, I just got hit in the head with all these china bulls when someone pushed me through the window. Did you just ask me something?"
12121111121211.title: Fake being dizzy as an excuse

choices: Man up, admit you were checking her out
Continue to play the dazed & confused role
121211111212112.content: "Yeah, right! I can tell when a guy's lying. My ex was a lowlife cheating lying dirtbag, and whenever he tried to put something over on me he looked just like you do now!"
121211111212112.title: She's not buying it

1212111112121121.content: "Okay, you got me. Sorry, it's just that I've been going through a dry spell since my last girlfriend dumped me. I know I shouldn't have taken more than a quick peek, but those little pink cheekies you're wearing under that skirt kinda got my imagination going. And be honest now, if you really didn't want a guy to look, you be wearing a longer skirt with big old grandma panties underneath, just in case..."
1212111112121121.title: Man up, admit you were checking her out

choices: Tell her you're sorry and walk away
Offer to help clean up the mess
12121111121211211.content: "Yeah, I guess you're right. It's just that I was so upset about my china shop being wrecked. And the last thing I want right now is some guy hitting on me."
12121111121211211.title: She's impressed with your honesty

12121111121212.content:
"any higher you'd be flying."
The manger stands her hands clinched.
"why you dirty lowlife!!!!!"
she pauses looking for the right word.
several come to your mind so you decide to help her.
12121111121212.title: Give her a funny one line reply

choices: Stay and Wait For the Beautiful Manager
1212111112122.content:
You tear your eyes away from the managers panties just in time and begin to stand up. She sees this and rushes over to you.

"Please Miss don't be sad. I can help you. I feel guilty. It was my body that was used to cause all this damage after all."

She responds, her voice a symphony of tenderness and beauty, "Oh you are a wonderful young man. I'm going to help you instead. Wait here."

She gently lays your head down and heads to the phone to call for help. You hear the vendor yell followed by a loud boom and can't help but wince.

Nonetheless the noise has caught your attention.
1212111112122.title: You Valiantly Stand and Offer the Manager Help

12121111121222.content:
You lie there and wait for the manager to come back. With her help you make a full recovery and you get to see live coverage of how the vendor was thrown through another window.

The boom was the result of an old car with exhaust issues which just happenned to explode at that moment.

Luckily for you the coverage didn't start until after you had hurled yourself through the window and apparently no one had seen this. Only you and your broker know the truth.

But why were you jumping through windows?

Well only you, Matt, and God know that. But with a beautiful women now at your side you don't see much reason to jump through a window ever again...
12121111121222.title: Stay and Wait For the Beautiful Manager

121211112.content:
You can't believe it, it's the mother of the child you sang to. For a moment you ask yourself where she's got your number from, but suddenly you decide that as long as she talks to you that's somehow irrelevant.
Her reason for calling you over is that her daughter explained everything to her, and now she feels sorry for beating you. Besides while beating you with her purse, her purse seems to have fallen into your shirt by accident, and she'd like to have it back. You fumble a bit in your shirt, and find the purse just in time, as some passants seem to misinterprete your activities within your shirt, and you hear the word "pervert" making the rounds. But then you find the purse, and hold it trumphiantly into the air to the cheers of the crowd. You call the pretty lady back, and tell her about your fulfilled quest. Some minutes later you meet, you give her her purse back, and suddenly you've got some real strange deja-vu. Because she starts hitting you again, perhaps she doesn't feel so sorry for beating you after all. Why you are running away you suddenly start to think that maybe she just wanted her purse back. And somehow she also seems to be into beating you. Could this be the beginning of a very strange relation, you think while running away. You loose her and somehow youre again in front of the china bulls shop.
121211112.title: Someone's sorry

12121112.content:
You trip over the sill on your way in and start falling forward. You try desperately
to stop yourself but it is hopeless. It almost feels like it's happening in slow motion as you crash into the standing shelf, knocking it over and sending the china bulls
tumbling to the ground.

An old man jumps up from behind the counter and calls out: "Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing!"
12121112.title: Like a Bull in a China Shop

121211121.content:
You trip over the sill on your way in and start falling forward. You try again desperately to stop yourself but it is hopeless. It almost feels like it's happening in slow motion as you crash into the standing shelf, knocking it over and sending the china bulls tumbling to the ground.

An old man jumps up from behind the counter and calls out: "Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing!"

"Sorry, I couldn't stop in time!" you reply.
121211121.title: Deja Vu

choices: What do you mean this time? the old man asks
Do you want to buy one of the bulls? the man asks
1212111211.content:
You trip over the sill on your way in and start falling forward. You try for a third
time to stop yourself but you're still falling. It almost feels like it's happening in slow motion which gives you time to lean to your left and hit the floor, narrowly
missing the standing shelf, thereby avoiding knocking it over and sending the china bulls tumbling to the ground.

An old man jumps up from behind the counter and calls out: "Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing!"

"Well at least I didn't knock the bulls over this time!" you reply
1212111211.title: Deja Vu All Over Again

12121112111.content:
"What do you mean, this time?" the shopkeeper asks.

"Come here, I'll show you." you respond, reaching out and taking him by the arm.

You notice that suddenly, inexplicably, once again you are standing outside in front of the small antique shop, only this time next to the shopkeeper.

"Now don't go in there, just watch me." you tell him, but he won't listen.

"It's my shop! Why the hell shouldn't I go in there!" he barks, as he opens the door.

“Don’t say I didn’t warn you!” you respond, as he enters the shop.

He trips over the sill on his way in and starts falling forward. You see him trying
desperately to stop himself but it is hopeless. It almost feels like it's happening in slow motion as you watch him crash into the standing shelf, knocking it over and sending the china bulls tumbling to the ground.

You bend down to help him get back on his feet. He dusts himself off, turns to you
and exclaims calmly:

"You know, I really oughta get that thing fixed one of these days."
12121112111.title: Deja Vu With a Twist

choices: Time for a little more jogging
12121112112.content:
"So are you going to buy a bull or not?" demands the shop keep. You think about it for a minute, then you pull out your wallet. Or rather, you reach into your pocket and try to pull out your wallet. It's at that moment you realize it's missing. "Uh," you mutter, "I don't have any cash on me right now..." This seems to truly aggrevate the shopkeep, "Get out of my store, before I call the cops!" he yells. You turn to leave, but somehow, your elbow manages to knock over one of the china bulls.

"THEIF!" screams the shopkeep as he picks up the phone...
12121112112.title: Tired of running yet?

choices: Just run away without looking around
121211121122.content:
So again its time for a little workout, if the day goes on like this you'll be running marathons by tomorrow. Well, but for now the only important thing is to get out of the shop, and well, to escape the angry mob which is again at your heels. The shopkeeper seems to have many friends in here, and all seem to enjoy hunting you.
After some sweatful ten minutes, you seem to got rid of the guys, they somehow stopped hunting you as you ran into that funny area here. But somehow you begin to wonder why all the skeletons lie here, and then, where does this hungry-sounding growl come from.
121211121122.title: The next run

info.brief_description: Get captured by pirates or chased by an angry fruit vendor. What more could you want?
info.description:
A: You wake up at a bus stop and go to sea.
B: You wake up in the ruins of a fruit stand.

Use your imagination, anything is possible here. Please rate, and add a chapter or two to keep the story going.
